channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Constant dumping of waste, 3rd November
item.description:
Waste and recycling dumped here on a daily basis. This is attracting vermin and further dumping throughout the local area and is becoming really serious.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clarence Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant dumping and leaving recycling out at incorrect times., 3rd November
item.description:
Residents at 13-18 Rowhill Mansions are constantly leaving recycling out, including food waste in general green bags, throughout the week, encouraging further dumping, vermin and vulnerable people to go through bags, littering the street. It is awful!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rowhill Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Union Jack Flags, 3rd November
item.description:
Last Wednesday night there were Union Jack flags put up along Sidcup Hill. These have been illegally put up and if the thread snaps and falls on driving cars you will be liable for accident or death from not removing these. You can say it is not causing immediate community tension however there have been 6 posts put on here in less than a week wishing for these flags to be removed. That is community tension which you are encouraging. If you continue to keep ignoring this then you will be seen to be actively encouraging them and therefore allowing political statements to suit agendas.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 96, Sidcup Hill, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dunped door, 3rd November
item.description:
Dumped door On the pavement
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lodge Hill, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant overflowing bin and dumping of waste, 3rd November
item.description:
There is a constantly overflowing bin and dumping of waste in this spot and on Rowhill Rd in general at the moment. Vulnerable local people and drug users have started going through this waste and scattering it across the street and in porches of property.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rowhill Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped, 3rd November
item.description:
This car has been dumped here for months now just taking up valuable tenant parking in a block where many residents vulnerable

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20-42, Bargrove Close, Crystal Palace, London

item.title: Dumped wheels bin with domestic waste and rubbish, 3rd November
item.description:
This abandoned wheel bin full of waste is on the abandoned corner of Tower Bridge Road and Queen Elizabeth Street, adjacent to Masq and opposite the back of Storey. It's a disgrace and likely to attract rats and foxes. The whole space needs clearing please. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 201, Tooley Street, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Dimped ladt night, 2.11.2025

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Nevill Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Extensive sinking of road between 68 and 79 Woodhurst Ave Petts Wood, 3rd November
item.description:
The substantial collapse of the road at several places in Woodhurst Ave continues to worsen. The problem has been widely reported by homeowners with no meaningful response from the Council. The first reports of this problem were filed by homeowners some eight months ago. The Councils only response is to say the problem is being investigated and work is underway to resolve the issue. Can we have some clarity about the Councils plans for resolving this increasing hazardous deterioration of the road surface between 68 and 79 Woodhurst .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lakeswood Road, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose manhole cover covered in leaves, 3rd November
item.description:
I was walking my dog in Queensmead recreation ground and I walked over the leafy ground where there was a loose manhole cover disguised by leaves. To my great distress I fell down the hole and was in great shock and pain. I'm still in pain and distress.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glassmill Lane, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Human forest bikes, 3rd November
item.description:
There are human forest bikes blocking pavement and cycle stand outside slip slow coffee shop. One bike is fallen over the pavement. It needs to be fixed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26-46, Lisson Grove, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown vegetation blocking pavement, 3rd November
item.description:
Overgrowing vegetation from the garden of 65 Birchwood Avenue Sidcup is increasingly restricting pedestrians using the pavement outside the property. Leaves/berries falling from the overgrown bushes are also making pavement slippery.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birchwood Avenue, Albany Park, London

item.description:

item.title: Road chaos: Temporary four-way Traffic Lights Broken next to schools, 3rd November
item.description:
Road chaos: Temporary four-way Traffic Lights Broken at the junction between Sylvan Hill/Sylvan Rd/Auckland Rd due to Thames water roadworks. The broken lights mean everyone skipping the lights at four-way junction next to two schools.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sylvan Hill, Upper Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped toilet, 3rd November
item.description:
As in picture, Hayne Road has it's own en suite facilities. This toilet has been there for at least 2 or 3 days. It's outside Hayne Court, 18 Hayne Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayne Road, Beckenham, London
